reviews.title: Newly remodelled, large rooms, good location.
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in July 2006, and was pleasantly surprised. Our room was huge--lots of space and a very large bathroom. Our room was very recently remodelled and was very clean and quiet. The location is right in town, walking distance to the shops, etc. Free internet is available in the hotel office, and there is free parking outside. The room was a bit pricey ($135 for a double) but we felt safe and comfortable.

reviews.title: Off beat, but very OK
reviews.text: This is a fun place with good, clean, large rooms. It's older, but being upgraded to very good standards. The only problem I had was that although I had email confirmation of my reservation, they didn't have it when I arrived. Sagway is a busy town and if they had been full, I would have been in a jam. Make doubly sure you have a reservation.

reviews.title: Sgt. Preston's Lodge
reviews.text: My husband and I visited Skagway in August of 2005, we stayed at Sgt. Preston's Lodge. The folks who own/run the establishment were extreamly helpful when we needed anything or wanted information. Our room was clean with easy access. They have a great mascot named Brodie who greated us upon our arrival. Sgt. Preston's Lodge has a public computer so you can make reservations or check your email or you can walk 1/2 block to the library. The lodge is located within walking distance to everything, or they offer shuttle service to the docks or airport. If we were to go back we would definately stay there again.

reviews.title: Alaska Hospitality
reviews.text: The room was clean and average size. The closet door mirrors made it seem bigger though. Nice big shower but sink is tiny. They treated me very well but didn't always get to my room in the week I was there.

reviews.title: Great place
reviews.text: Convenient location. They really need to put a small refrigerator and a coffee maker in the rooms. Overall a good experience, I would stay there again and hopefully with the improvements.
